metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5240 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in wp-includes/pluggable.php in WordPress before 3.9.2, when Multisite is enabled, allows remote authenticated administrators to inject arbitrary web script or HTML, and obtain Super Admin privileges, via a crafted avatar URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.2+dfsg-1').
